DOC.brief_summary: A prospective study determine safety intraosseous ( IO ) access period 48 hour healthy adult volunteer volunteer history mild moderate renal disease and/or control diabetes .
DOC.brief_title: Continuous Intraosseous Vascular Access Over 48 Hours
DOC.detailed_description: A prospective , study determine safety intraosseous ( IO ) access period 48 hour , healthy adult volunteer volunteer history health-compromised , include patient mild moderate renal disease ( National Health Nutrition Examination Survey Stage 1 3 ) and/or patient control diabetes . Subjects randomize receive IO access proximal tibia insertion site proximal humerus insertion site use EZ-IO intraosseous vascular access system . The hypothesis serious complication subject 48 hour IO catheter dwell time either place .
DOC.criteria: 21 year old Self Identifying poor vascular access Healthy Having least one follow condition : Controlled diabetes , evidence glycosylated hemoglobin A1c ( HbA1c ) value less equal 8 % time screen . Renal disease , Stages 1 3 , evidence presence albuminuria time screen . Subjects albumincreatinine ratio ( ACR ) must fall within microalbuminuria macroalbuminuria value : Microalbuminuria ACR 17250 mcg/mg men ; 25355 mcg/mg woman , Macroalbuminuria ACR > 250 mcg/mg men ; > 355 mcg/mg woman Imprisoned Self identify pregnant Cognitively impaired Fracture target bone Excessive tissue and/or absence adequated anatomical landmark target bone Signs symptom infection target area IO insertion past 48 hour , prosthetic limb joint significant orthopedic procedure target bone Intravenous infusion within past 30 day Current use anticoagulant Previous adverse reaction know allergy Lidocaine Current cardiac condition require pacemaker Currently take beta blocker calcium channel blocker heart arrhythmia ( use beta blocker calcium channel blocker hypertension allow indication hypertension confirm physician Previous surgery peripheral arterial disease History ulcer extremities History bilateral lymph node dissection arm legs Known sicklecell disease sign symptoms vascular disease vascular insufficiency extremity , identify upon physical examination History peripheral vascular disease Hyperkalemia evidence potassium level great 5.1 mmol/L upper limit hte normal reference range screening
